author: Wineaway
title: Origins - a wonderful restaurant
text:
Lunch at Origins is a must!
We arrived just as the weather took a turn for the worst and opted not to on the sea side of the building. We were in the part of the restaurant which had a slightly distant view of the kitchen. It was interesting to watch the chefs at work,
Even more interesting was the wonderful food they produced. We shared the from the Shoots Stems and Leaves menu;
Origin’s salad, pear, gruberg cheese, walnut, celery, bacon bits, croutons, Dijon vinaigrette
The Buratta cheese, grilled peaches, prosciutto, lemon olive oil, rocket. Both were superb and imaginatively served.
From the Hunted menu we chose:
Elgin free range chicken, roast baby beets, quinoa, pine nut & sage emulsion,
aubergine cream - there were also crisp, mint leaves - I think a very interesting addition. A joy to eat - and I didn't share one bit!
Simply roast fish (Cob), wok-fried vegetables, Thai pesto which my husband pronounce as brilliant.
Deserts, once again shared, were:
Madagascan chocolate parfait, hazelnut yoghurt, blueberries
and
Trio of crème brûlée - chocolate, fruit & spice
Both delicious!
Really good coffee finished our meal!
Letitia, the restaurant manager and her staff were friendly and attentive.
As we spend 5 months of the year in te Cape, we've decided that we must lunch here more oftenand work our way through the menu!
PLEASE NOTE MY HOTEL RATING IS BASED PURELY ON OUR TIME IN THE ESTAURANT AAND WALKING ROUND THE HOTEL.
MESSAGE TO TRIPADVISOR WHEN A HOTEL RESTAURANT IS AS GOOD AS ORIGINS - WHY NOT HAVE A WAY TO ALLOW CONTRIBUTORS TO DO A PROPER RESTAURANT REVIEW?
